data.text: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun,
A man to whom God shall give
If a man beget a hundred children, and live many years,
For he came in vanity, and departs in darkness,
Moreover he has not seen the sun, nor known rest:
Though he has lived to the return of a thousand years,
All the labor of a man is for his mouth,
For what advantage has the wise man over the fool,
The sight of the eyes is better than that which wanders in soul:
If anything has been, its name has already been called:
For there are many things which increase vanity.
